greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is the expansion of (Product_{j>=1} (1 - x^(2*j))^5/((1 - x^j)*(1 - x^(4*j)))^2)^k.
comment: A(n,k) is the number of ways of writing n as a sum of k squares.
This is the transpose of the array in A122141.
maple: A:= proc(n, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(n<0 or k<1, 0,
seq(seq(A(n, d-n), n=0..d), d=0..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, May 27 2017
mathematica: Table[A[n, d-n], {d, 0, 12}, {n, 0, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 28 2018, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, May 27 2017
